title: Synthetic Recap
body:
PHOENIX — The story of the game was not found on the scoreboard, but in the box score. In a dominant 101-76 victory for the Phoenix Suns over the Dallas Mavericks, one name eclipsed all others: Kevin Johnson.

The Suns’ guard engineered a historic and breathtaking performance, pouring in a game-high 44 points. Johnson was a whirlwind of efficiency and aggression, attacking the rim at will and carving up the Mavericks’ defense. His 44-point outburst was not just a season-high; it was a signature performance that reminded the league of his elite scoring prowess.

While the final score indicated a complete team victory for Phoenix, this was Johnson’s masterpiece. The Suns’ defense deserves credit for holding Dallas to a meager 76 points, but the offensive end was a one-man show. Every time Dallas threatened to build momentum, Johnson had an answer, slicing through the lane or pulling up for a clutch jumper to extinguish any hope of a comeback.

The Mavericks, simply outmatched by the singular brilliance of Johnson, had no answer. Their offense sputtered against a stifling Phoenix defense, but their fate was truly sealed by the unstoppable force wearing number 7.

In the annals of the 1997 season, this night in the desert will be remembered not for the lopsided win, but for the virtuoso performance of Kevin Johnson, who single-handedly authored a victory for the Suns with a career-defining 44 points.
